claim_text: Costa Rica has achieved nearly universal electricity access, with rates around 99.5%.
Over 98% of Costa Rica's electricity is generated from renewable sources, primarily hydropower, geothermal, and wind.
Uruguay provides electricity to over 99.8% of its population.
Kenya has rapidly increased electricity access, reaching approximately 75% of its population.
Approximately 90% of Kenya's grid-based electricity comes from renewable sources, especially geothermal and hydropower.
Nearly 100% of Iceland's electricity is generated from renewable hydropower and geothermal sources.
In 2021, West Virginia had the highest rate of COPD prevalence among adults in the US.
In 2022, coal-fired power plants generated 88% of West Virginia's total electricity.
In 2021, Kentucky had one of the highest rates of COPD prevalence among adults.
In 2022, coal fueled about 68% of Kentucky's electricity generation.
In 2022, Missouri and Indiana generated more than half of their electricity from coal, at 63% and 53% respectively.
The national median prevalence of COPD among adults was 6.4% in 2021.
Yes, obesity in America is continuing to increase. According to data from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) for 2017-March 2020, the obesity prevalence among U.S. adults was 41.9%.
This represents a significant increase from the 1999-2000 period, when the adult obesity prevalence was 30.5%.
The prevalence of severe obesity has also risen, increasing from 4.7% in 1999-2000 to 9.2% in 2017-March 2020.
Childhood obesity is also a growing concern, with a prevalence of 20.7% among U.S. children and adolescents aged 2-19 years in 2017-2020.
